itemDescription: English rugby union and rugby league footballer

wikipedia_page.main: Arthur Gray (4 September 1917 – 25 August 1991) was an English rugby union, and professional rugby league footballer who played in the 1940s. He played representative level rugby union (RU) for England, and at club level for Otley, as a full-back, i.e. number 15, and club level rugby league (RL) for Wakefield Trinity (Heritage № 560), as a fullback, i.e. number 1.

response: * Arthur Gray (Fullback for England while at Otley RUFC in 1947 against Wales, Ireland, and Scotland)
*Arthur Gray (rugby) (1917–1991), rugby union and rugby league footballer of the 1940s for England (RU), Otley, and Wakefield Trinity (RL)
*Arthur Gray (Hawkhurst Gang) (1713–1748), one of the leaders of the notorious Hawkhurst Gang, who was executed in 1748
*Paddy Gray (cricketer) (1892–1977), born Arthur Gray, Australian cricketer
* E. Arthur Gray (1925–2007), American politician from New York
